snippet: The city should instruct police not to seize condoms from women on the street. Condoms are not only legal; they are crucial to the anti-AIDS effort.
abstract: Editorial supports bill in the New York State Assembly that would bar police from using condoms as evidence against women charged with prostitution; urges the Bloomberg administration to drop its opposition to the bill, citing the fact that such 'condom policing' discourages some sex workers from carrying condoms, which are essential to the anti-AIDS effort.
lead_paragraph: The city should instruct police not to seize condoms from women on the street. Condoms are not only legal; they are crucial to the anti-AIDS effort.
